Class HumanPlayer

java.lang.Object
Player
HumanPlayer
public class HumanPlayer
extends Player
Provides data fields and methods to create a Java data-type, representing a human player in a tic tac toe game program. Extends the abstract class, Player.
Since:
July 23, 2021

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class Player

    board, mark, name, opponent

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Modifier Constructor Description
    protected HumanPlayer​(java.lang.String n, char m)
    Contructs a new HumanPlayer object by calling the super constructor to assign name and mark to the given String and char values.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    protected void makeMove()
    Asks the human player to enter the coordinates in which they want to place their mark.
    protected void play()
    Allows human player to make a move, displays the board, then passes the turn to the other player until there is a winner or the game ends in a tie.

    Methods inherited from class Player

    findName, setBoard, setOpponent

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • HumanPlayer

      protected HumanPlayer​(java.lang.String n, char m)
      Contructs a new HumanPlayer object by calling the super constructor to assign name and mark to the given String and char values.
      Parameters:
      n - name of Player
      m - mark of Player

  • Method Details

    • play

      protected void play()
      Allows human player to make a move, displays the board, then passes the turn to the other player until there is a winner or the game ends in a tie. Prints out a message at the end of the game, indicating the winner or that the game ended in a tie.
      Specified by:
      play in class Player

    • makeMove

      protected void makeMove()
      Asks the human player to enter the coordinates in which they want to place their mark. If the space is empty, a mark will be placed. If the space is already marked, the player will be prompted to try again until they enter coordinates for a valid space on the board.
      Specified by:
      makeMove in class Player
